data.label: Canvas Navigation
data.description:
The canvas is your workspace for building learning paths. Understanding how to navigate it efficiently will make your editing experience smooth and intuitive.

The canvas uses a grid system that helps you align nodes precisely. All your changes are automatically saved and synced with your team in real-time.

data.label: Working with Nodes
data.description:
Nodes are the building blocks of your learning path. Each node represents a topic or concept that learners need to understand.

There are two types of nodes:

‚¨õ Topics (Dark): Main categories or core concepts. These serve as anchors for your learning path structure.

‚¨ú Subtopics (Light): Detailed concepts that branch off from topics. Use these to break down complex subjects into manageable pieces.

Click on any node to view or edit its content!

üí° Tip: Create topics first to define your main structure, then add subtopics to elaborate on each area!

data.label: Connecting Nodes
data.description:
Edges are the lines that connect nodes together, showing the relationships and learning sequence between concepts.

Connections help learners understand:
‚Ä¢ Prerequisites: What they need to know first
‚Ä¢ Progression: How topics build on each other
‚Ä¢ Relationships: How concepts are related

A well-connected diagram creates a clear learning journey!

data.label: Creating Connections
data.description:

üîå Connection Points (Handles):
‚Ä¢ Small circles appear on node edges when hovering
‚Ä¢ Topics have handles on all 4 sides
‚Ä¢ Subtopics have handles on left/right sides

üîó How to Connect:
1. Hover over a node to reveal handles
2. Click and drag from any handle
3. Drag the line to another node's handle
4. Release when the handle highlights

üìè Connection Rules:
‚Ä¢ Nodes cannot connect to themselves
‚Ä¢ Duplicate connections are prevented
‚Ä¢ The connection radius is forgiving (50px)

üí° Tip: Topic-to-topic connections show progression. Topic-to-subtopic connections show detail breakdown!

data.label: Removing Connections
data.description:

üñ±Ô∏è Select and Delete:

üîÑ Automatic Cleanup:
‚Ä¢ When you delete a node, all its connected edges are automatically removed

üí° Tip: You can select multiple edges and delete them all at once!
